Description: Vue de Thebes du plus loin qu'on peut l'appercevoir, one of three studies for Plate 43 of the artist's 'Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Egypte, pendant les campagnes du Général Bonaparte', 1802; distant view of Thebes, the river Nile in the foreground Pen and grey ink, with grey wash
Producer name: Drawn by: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Curator's comments: Engraved by Louis Pierre Baltard. There is no copy of Denon's 'Voyage...' in the Department. The B.L. copy is at 458.h.12. The minutes of the Trustees' meeting on 12th December, 1835, record that "two or three" of the drawings were missing when the group was offered to the Museum.
Associated names: Associated with: Napoléon I, Emperor of the French (Napoleon)
Illustration to: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Associated places: Topographic representation of: Thebes (historic - Upper Egypt)
Associated titles: Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Egypte
